message: So I've been on a bit of an icon high recently with http://w.glyphlibrary.com - but a problem I have is now that I've got 500 icons, is there any efficient way of putting them in a grid (to show them off) in Photoshop, rather than using rulers/guides & dragging them into place myself?

I just tried it out and it seems to need a bit of practice but I reckon I'm getting there. I've been using scripts a lot in Ai to export as PNG in different sizes (export scaling %) - any chance you know of a script to distribute say 100 icons in a 10x10 grid?
but it should be a good start
depending on the size and placement of your layers, you may not get pixel-perfect spacing
i'm certain you could use photoshop actions to create something to grid your icons, but i don't know of native functionality that'll do it.
tool options will appear at the top of the screen for aligning and distributing the layers
OK, thanks - I'll try that out.
PS has some rudimentary distribution abilities
assuming your icons are on separate layers, or in separate groups, select all of the layers in a single row or column
I actually found this a few minutes ago but it doesn't work perfectly - it staggers rather than gridding. Great for creating a single row/column of icons at a time; though.
